events.text: [color=#ffed29](What…just happened?!)
[color=#ffed29](I’m fired??)

[color=#ffed29](AND I GUESS… HOMELESS??)
[color=#ffed29](SHOOT, I’VE GOT FACTORY EMPLOYEE HOUSING.)
[i]Arghhh…
[color=#ffed29](This is so unfair. What am I supposed to do?)

[color=#ffed29](I guess I could probably crash at Herb’s while I figure stuff out?)
[color=#ffed29](But I wouldn’t wanna stay too long, I know he’s got a big family already.)
[color=#ffed29](Man…)
You.
You have not eaten at All Bread Patisserie.
…Uh, yeah, I haven’t?
Come and spend money at our cafe.
I…
[color=#ffed29](Why not. I mean, what else am I supposed to do?)
Sure, why not.

Good.
Come with me.
Oh. Okay?
Uh, what’s your name??
Blight.
Okay, Blight, I’m Orven.
Orven.
[color=#ffed29](Geez, I hope the restaurant is close by.)
We have arrived.
Oh, okay?
Come with me.
Okay?
Boss. I have acquired a new customer.
Oh! Great! I’m glad Blight’s advertising worked!
Advertising?
Yeah, we’re trying new marketing techniques!
I went to a distressed person and told them to come to ABP.
Hey!
You were pacing back and forth, tachypneic, and mumbling to yourself.
I…yeah, no, you’re right.
Wow, a perfect success rate!
[color=#ffed29](Does that count as advertising and marketing? It was closer to a kidnapping!)
[color=#ffed29](Wait. Am I an easy kidnapping target?)
The name’s Rondeau Impoli, and I’m the owner of All Bread Patisseries!
Orven Zanry, nice to meet you?
Can I ask some questions on how our marketing went?
Uh, sure?
How did our advertising make you feel?
Uh, mostly confused…If I’m feeling anything else, it’s masked by the confusion.
Why was Blight looking for a stressed person specifically?
Stress can lead people to eat.
We were trying to find people right before they started getting hungry, so we could sell them food!
Oh?
Stress, exercise, and thinking about food.

This is why I went to you, when you were stressed, and talked about food.
Two for one. Assured customer.
Uh, why don’t you just go when it’s lunch time?
I mean…I know I get hungry when it’s lunch time, because my stomach knows I usually eat around then?

!!! 
I have read about Circadian rhythms.
They are that potent?
I think for most people?
Chronomancy.

See, Blight? I told you we don’t need to advertise!
We’re open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner, what else do we need?
Profit.

I take pride in that we always break even!
That’s a lot of math I have to do!

Why are you implying that you do not enjoy the math?
You are more proficient as a mathematician than a business owner.
ABP isn’t [i]about[/i] [b]profit, it's [i]about...
[wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1]…bread?
ABP is a business, businesses require profit.
Speaking of not making profit, since you’re new, here’s a meal on the house!
Blight, give ’em… [wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1][rainbow freq=1.0 sat=0.8 val=0.8]"The Special."
[rainbow freq=1.0 sat=0.8 val=0.8]“The Special?”
Close! But you gotta add more oomph to it!
[wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1][rainbow freq=1.0 sat=0.8 val=0.8]"The Special."
[wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1][rainbow freq=1.0 sat=0.8 val=0.8]"The Special."
Perfect!
The special has been labeled "Spicy Bread."
"Spicy Bread" is a bread with a spice of your choosing on it.
I see how it got its name?
It was a collaborative effort between the Boss and myself.
[color=#ffed29](Both of you?)
And it tastes…good?
I learned from the best, so it can’t not be good!

events.question: Please select from the designated list of spices to put on your bread. The selections change daily to promote returning customers.

events.text: Cinnamon?
The correct choice.
[color=#ffed29](The other choices were insane!!)
[color=#ffed29](Imma need some water after this.)

!!!!!!
Somehow, [wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1]it’s better than I expected?
Cumin?
The savory choice.
[color=#ffed29](It’s still weird, but it’s not the dashi.)
[color=#ffed29](I’ve never put cumin on anything aside from meat.)

!!!!!!
Somehow, [wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1]it’s better than I expected?
Paprika?
The red choice.

[color=#ffed29](I feel like with all of these, I can more-or-less guess what it’ll taste like.)
[color=#ffed29](They should definitely include a complimentary drink with this, though.)
I made the bread red.

!!!!!!
Somehow, [wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1]it’s better than I expected?
Salt?
The saltiest choice.
[color=#ffed29](I’d assume so???)
The worst choice.

The other options are just too crazy.
Please don’t put too much salt on, I don’t wanna burn my tongue.
There is a [wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1]mound of salt[/wave] on this bread.
[color=#ffed29](Oh no… I don’t wanna eat this. But it’s free…)

!!!!!!
Somehow, [wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1]it’s better than I expected?
Dashi?
My preferred choice.
[color=#ffed29](THE DASHI???)
[color=#ffed29](I’m coming in like a mortician, trying to figure out what the damage is for this monstrosity.)

[color=#ffed29](What the???)
[color=#ffed29](No way???)

!!!!!!
Somehow, [wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1]it’s better than I expected?
[color=#ffed29](I finished the bread???)
Spicy Bread may rotate spice options, but the quality and satisfaction remain constant.
HOW???
Proprietary.

[color=#ffed29](What in Gramma’s kitchen happened to make a slice of white bread with a random spice and NOTHING ELSE taste good???)
[color=#ffed29](And that was surprisingly filling???)

Nothing magical is going on with the meals, right…?
Like, I won’t end up a frog tomorrow morning for eating this?
No magical substances are put in this, and no enchantments have been performed on the bread.
Why would we want to turn our customers into frogs?
I just can’t believe that this would taste good! You gotta have some sort of magic to make this work…
Does love count?
[shake rate=20.0 level=5 connected=1]NO!
I put no love in the bread.
BLIGHT!

I have never put any love in the bread. I never will.
Love does not have any flavor additives that would enhance the product.
It’s not about the flavor, it’s about the [wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1][i]feeling.

Clearly, love does not need to be added.
The product, without any love, evoked good feelings in the customer right now.
We’ll work on this…
Come back another day and your bread will be filled with flavor and love!
Imma have to come back, because this is actually breaking my brain.
Truth is often mind-altering to humans.
[i]Haha![/i] It’s just that good!
Glad you enjoyed it.

[i]Haha[/i], well, I appreciate the free food.
It’s…I had a rough morning, so I really needed this, I think.

Oh, I’m sorry you had a hard morning, Orven.
I hope I’m not prying if I ask what happened?

Nah, man, it’s cool.
I got fired from my job.
That stinks. Budget cuts?
Nah, the manager had it out for me.

Dang.
From your uniform, I’m assuming you worked at Avidine Factory?

Yup, I moved to Germanon for this job.
And now…I don’t even know what I’m gonna do.

You can get fired if your manager “has it out for you?”
Please explain. I wish to avoid being fired.
I am unsure if there is anyone on this planet that would hire me outside of Rondeau.
I’ll take that as a compliment!

But…sometimes, managers are…unfair.
And they fire people without them doing anything to warrant being fired.

It does not make sense that they have the positions they do.
If they are going to make such judgements unfairly, they should not be managers.
You’re telling me…you can suck it, Mr. Gungand.
Mr. Gungand. I have only heard bad things about this man.
Who else is talking about Mr. Gungand??
Uh, I have a couple friends who work with him tangentially.
"Muscular hoofed quadruped mammal with a long face" man.
You guys know Mr. Throck and Mr. Babinski??
Yeah!!!
It’s wild that you know them.

Not wild, we run a restaurant chain throughout the entire city.
We know many people.

The thing that’s so crazy, right—is, that genuinely, they were the MOST helpful people I talked to about the project.
My managers, my coworkers, my boss??
None of them could clarify things, but the JONES BROTHERS?
The Jones brothers had my back, and [b]Remedium’s[/b] back.
This whole thing is so messed up.
[i]Ahh[/i], darn, I forgot.
Oh, MAN! I forgot I made a promise to the Jones brothers.
Is everything alright?
I gotta go to the doctor’s…
You are ill.

No…I mean, it was to help with [b]Remedium.
But I’m not even employed there anymore, so do I [i]have[/i] to go?

events.question: Why did you wanna go in the first place?

events.text: For [b]Remedium.
High devotion to your job, for what reason.
Well, I mean, yeah, I think working for Mister Avidine was the inital reason I looked for a job there.
But I worked hard because it was for a good cause!

The [b]Devil’s Lung[/b] is a very real and very [i]bad[/i] disease. People die from it!
If we can get medicine out there to help people, that would be incredible!
It’s not just a job—people’s lives are at stake here!

Very understandable. Commendable.
Humanoids are various levels of fragile.
Well…do you think you still need to talk to this doctor?
…Yeah…

Gross, yuck, okay.
I guess I should head out, since Mr. Babinski said she’d be free this evening, and I gotta get down to the Southside.
If you can minimize your friction then you can get there faster.
How would I do that?
…I do not know. But my previous statement remains true.
I guess?
Feel free to visit us anytime, Orven! Thanks for doing this for the city!

[i]Haha[/i], okay, I will.
Thanks, Rondeau; thanks, Blight!
For everyone’s health!
Explain.
The [b]Devil’s Lung[/b] is unmanageable and deadly! We need something fast, or half the people in the city are going to die!

The only thing that could get me to the doctors again was the idea of it somehow helping to save everyone.
Even I would go to the doctor’s for that…
A righteous cause that can be achieved without your job at the factory.

What? I can’t make the potion!
I didn’t handle the actual substance, I just made its container!

Knowledge.
You desire knowledge, you can do so, and you know who you need to talk to achieve this.

I think what Blight’s trying to get at is: would you be satisfied not doing anything?
I don’t think you could be.

…...
…No, I know.
I gotta go see Dr. Ki.
Once you have learned about the [b]Devil’s Lung[/b], return to learn more about “Spicy Bread."
[i]Haha[/i], I told you that I have to come back!
Good luck, Orven.

Thanks, man.
Appreciate you too, Blight, I’ll be seeing you both!
Orven Zanry.
You appear distressed.

Blight!
Wow, you just appeared out of nowhere.

Not nowhere, I arrived from All Bread Patisseries on my way to another All Bread Patisseries.
As expected.
Why are you pacing back and forth?
I…I just got fired.

I’ve only been working there for a little over a month, and I’m fired!
They provided my housing, so now I don’t have anywhere to live, and my family is from Germanon...
And I have [i]some[/i] money stored but I can’t live off it for forever…

…Your means of income has been stripped from you and you are facing displacement.
These are large changes you did not anticipate.
Why did you do something to risk your employment?

I didn’t!!! I mean, not really?
I broke into my manager’s office, but people do that all the time.
But more than that, they just didn’t want me looking into [b]Remedium[/b], even though something is very wrong with it!
And I’m, like, are you guys CRAZY?? We’ll never pass if we never change??
But I think I really pushed some buttons by trying to help [b]Remedium[/b], which makes NO sense.
SHOULDN’T WE ALL BE TRYING TO HELP [b]REMEDIUM[/b]?!
I do not believe I should.

No, sorry…I meant everyone who worked at the factory.
I mean, if our goal was to make the safest and best cure we could for [b]The Devil’s Lung[/b], why were people so mad when I was trying to make it safer?
Why did I have to get fired??

......
…What am I going to do?
Go to All Bread Patisseries.

I…I am on my way to take an order at another location, but go to the main one with Rondeau.
When I have these sorts of large questions, talking to Rondeau has helped.
He may be a terrible businessman, but he is a good friend.

[i]Haha[/i], thanks, Blight.
I guess I’ll hang at ABP—I got nothing better to do.
Good.

Do not lose your heart and courage, Orven Zanry.
Your humanity is a good thing.
Thanks, Blight. I’ll see you!
Yes.
[color=#ffed29](Well, I guess I might as well see the friendliest face in the city.)

[color=#ffed29](I hope Rondeau doesn’t mind me hanging out, I feel like I’ve quickly become a regular.)
[color=#ffed29](But that was closer to closing time, I don’t wanna bug him if they’re busy.)
Rondeau!!!
Orven! You’re here earlier than usual!
Usual?

events.question: Yeah! He works at the Avidine factory, so he stops by after his shift ends.

events.text: Not anymore, I got FIRED, Rondeau!
Fired???

I have a hard time believing you’d do something that would get you fired?
You seemed like you really cared about the work you did there.
Cared a little too much, I guess!
Cared more than Mr. Gungand, and he couldn’t have anyone try to help in any meaningful way, so he got rid of me!
And now? I’m SCREWED.
I’m here because my shift [i]did[/i] end.
Did you request a half day?
No.
Oh, then everyone got out early?
Nope.
You were fired.
Fired?!

YUP.
You got it, uh…
I’m so sorry, I just came in ranting about myself.
I’m Orven Zanry, and I’m upset that I got fired today.
This is my nephew, Tangeau!
Oh! I remember you mentioned him when you gave me a ride home!
Must you mention me to EVERYONE you meet?
I can’t help it, you mean so much to me!
[i]sigh
Don’t worry, he didn’t say anything bad!

He never does.
But he always says too much.

I know, I know.
I’m not like you and Bongeau, I talk while I think, not before.
UNCLE.

Oh, I, uh, already know about Bongeau.
He was your dad, right?
He already knows?
I gave Orven a ride back to his apartment, and we talked about our loved ones who had passed!
It was nice learning about Bongeau, and I was happy to talk about my Grampa.
I just want to let people know him, you know?

…I do know.
And it would be fine under [b]any [i]other[/i] circumstance.
[b]Please[/b], Uncle.
Okay, Tangeau, I’m sorry.
I just want to keep you safe.
And I just want you to be happy.

Nice to meet you, Tangeau.
Your uncle’s one of the nicest people I know!

Yes, that's my uncle.
Kind to a fault.
It’s all because of you and Bongeau!
UNCLE.
[color=#ffed29](Bongeau?)
Ah, sorry, Tangeau. I just like talking about him.
But is it [i]wise[/i] to?
I’m always thinking about him—I can’t help it if it slips out sometimes.
And you think I’M NOT?
No...
[b]Please[/b], Uncle.
Okay, Tangeau, if it’ll make you happy.
[color=#ffed29](Oh, looks like Tangeau is here.)

events.question: [color=#ffed29](He’s talking with Rondeau. What should I do?)

events.text: [color=#ffed29](Last time I was quiet, and it looked like I was snooping. I should just announce myself.)
Hey guys!

[color=#ffed29](Kinda awkward including Tangeau in the “guys,” since he doesn’t really like me, but we’re gonna be confident and sell it.)
[color=#ffed29](And he’ll be sold on our friendship!)
Orven! You’re here earlier than usual!
Yessir! Blight saw me and told me to come here.
Oh, really? He usually doesn’t stop for anyone when he’s going from one ABP to the next.

Blight was being a good friend.
He said I should come here to talk to you about the fact that I was fired.
Fired!?
On what basis?
[color=#ffed29](Wow, I didn’t think Tangeau would be remotely interested in my life.)
Because my manager had it out for me.
Really?

Honestly…yeah.
I know it sounds like I’m avoiding blame, but I look back, and I don’t think I did anything wrong.
It really feels like I’m being punished for trying to do right.
I’m sorry...

It’s okay, thanks for listening.
Sorry to dump this on you all of a sudden.
No, no, I’m glad you came here. I’m here to listen.
Will you back down?
Back down?
[color=#ffed29](I’ll just…wait til they’re done.)

You just seem more tense.
Is something happening?
…Don’t worry about it, Uncle.
Tangeau…

Don’t worry about me, Uncle, truly.
You know I need to know, and I know…
I know you’re not ready to know.
[color=#ffed29](Wow, even Rondeau can be that sad, huh.)

If you want to help me, please just stay inside the complex tonight.
It’ll be safe there, and I’ll be the happiest knowing that you’ll be safe.
Are you going to be safe?

I won’t die.
I would never do that to you.
Tangeau…please.

I need to know, Uncle.
Don’t worry, that’s why I took over, right?
Because I can do this.
I have to do this.
For Dad.
And as for the fly on the wall.
[color=#ffed29](How long has he known I was here?)

Orven Zanry, 18 years old from Germanon, this is the second instance you have eavesdropped on a conversation between Impolis.
Know it will be the last.
I’m sorry, man, I really didn’t mean to…
Just as [i]I[/i] did not mean to come across the fact that you’ve been fired.
Fired?!
How did you know??

You mustn’t underestimate me.
I know many things, including Olivia Zanry, Darius Zanry…
[color=#ffed29](My Gramma and Grampa’s names…?)
Sandy, Nolan, Keon, Herwin, and Chestnut Tamboor, as well as Sage, Bernard, Quinn, Jamie, and Daran Langtree –
Tangeau, listen, I’m sorry I overheard you talking, but you really shouldn’t do it in a public place if you’re going to be this weird about it.

Weird? I’m just talking more, since you seem to enjoy listening to me.
So hear me when I say…...
Adelaide Lamont and Eli Lamont.
[color=#ffed29]([i]MY PARENTS.[/i])
What are you trying to do…

I am a connoisseur of knowledge, and as such I know when I see someone who is interested in things they should not be interested in.
Know that it is in [b]everyone’s best interest[/b] that this remain a one-way street.
Am I understood?
…What’s wrong with you, man? Are you threatening me?!
I thought you would be smart enough not to ask.
[b]TANGEAU.

This is [b]business.
Uncle, defer.
We are in ABP, this is [i]my business[/i], and I, as the owner, am saying that [b]you may not threaten my customers!
I am protecting our family.
Against [b]Orven??
Against a stranger.
This is out of line.
Agreed, you are out of line. Let us not forget ourselves.
[i]sigh

Uncle, I’m sorry.
Just…be careful.

And Orven?
You’re a little too nosy for my liking.
Watch yourself.
Rondeau?
Yeah, Orven?
Your nephew is a jerk.

[i]Haha[/i], yeah…sorry.
He’s just like this sometimes, just really protective over me and his dad, you know?
Does he ever chill???

Yeah, no, he does.
But lately, it seems like he does it less and less…
Well, I’m sure when he isn’t having a conniption, he’s a decent guy.

[i]Haha[/i], more than decent.
He’s great, truly.
Well…hopefully, I see that side of him someday.
Uncle Rondeau! Uncle Tangeau!
[color=#ffed29](Phew, glad someone changed the topic. That was a [b]tense[/b] conversation.)
[color=#ffed29](I don’t wanna snoop, but maybe I can ask Rondeau more about Bongeau when Tangeau isn’t here.)
[color=#ffed29](I wonder what Tangeau meant by that.)
I want “Ups,” Uncle Rondeau!
Of course! What’s the magic password?
TONGO!
That’s right!!! Uncle [i]Tongo!
WHEE!!!

It’s TAN-geau, Uncle!
Why do you insist on teaching Matty your nonsense!
[wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1]Tongo! Tongo!!!

Sorry, Uncle Tangeau, he says your name right whenever he’s at home!
I think he just does it to get his “Ups.”
And no one does “Ups” like Uncle Rondeau.

You don’t need to apologize for Uncle Rondeau’s silliness, Lunette. Let’s think of a silly name to call Uncle Rondeau.
What about…[rainbow freq=1.0 sat=0.8 val=0.8]Ron-doo-doo?
[color=#ffed29](Never thought I’d hear Tangeau say that???)
That’s TOO silly!
Then…Ronald?
That’s just a name!

Looks like [i]you[/i] gotta come up with a silly name for Uncle Rondeau to balance it out.
I’m no good at this.
Ooh, I’ll think about a good name!
[color=#ffed29](These kids are really comfortable with the Impolis, they must come here often.)
[color=#ffed29](Didn’t think that Tangeau would be good with kids.)
Hello!
Oh, hi! Are these your kids?

[i]Haha[/i], no, I’m their babysitter.
My name is Meldan!

I'm Orven, nice to meet you, Meldan!
Are you guys regulars?

Yep, the kids love ABP.
Where else are they going to get “Animal food?”
Animal food??
Don’t worry, it’s like, regular food, in the shape of animals, [i]haha.
Oh okay, phew! Good to know that the “Slop and Flop” isn’t like, actual pig food.

I know, right?
At ABP, it really could be pig food.

Uncle, wait, isn’t that too HIGH?!
Matty, are you okay??
[shake rate=50.0 level=20 connected=10]AAAAAHHHH!!! Hahaha![/shake]
I don’t know, is it too HIGH, Matty!?
NO!!! [i]Hahaha!
Just watch his head, Uncle Rondeau, don’t let it hit the ceiling!

Wow, is that how Rondeau got so big?
He’s been doing “Ups” for a while, and I feel like Matty is only getting higher.
Yeah, it’s a tough act to follow.
Must be a rich family if they got you babysitting in that uniform.
The same rich family as yours!

!!!!!!
[color=#ffed29](His lapel!)

You work for the Avidines?
These are THE AVIDINE KIDS??
[i]Haha[/i], yup.
That’s Matty Avidine being thrown, and Lunette Avidine talking with Tangeau.

Great kids. Really smart, really kind.
They take after their parents.
That’s wild, man, that you see Mister Avidine in his house and stuff.

Yeah, the kids love playing hide-and-seek with him because he takes it super seriously.
He’ll accidentally pop the seams in his suit and stuff so that he can fit in weird places.
Mrs. Avidine isn’t happy when he does that though, [i]haha.
I’m sure, those suits must be expensive!

And Mrs. Avidine is amazing when she does stories. She gets super into characters, does different voices for them—it’s great.
And when she plays her flute with Lunette’s piano? It’s special.
That’s so cool, man.
How’s Mr. Avidine at the factory?
Oh, I mean, he’s really impressive. He has this air around him, you know?
But, uh…I don’t work for him anymore.
Oh, no? What happened?
I got fired…
Oh jeez, I’m sorry. Mr. Avidine fired you?
Nah, the guy underneath him.
I was going to say, that didn’t sound like him.
I’m sorry about that, man, that stinks.
Thanks, man, appreciate it.
Are you okay?

Yeah…you know, I was going to do something I didn’t [i]super[/i] wanna do today for the sake of like [b]Remedium[/b] and stuff.
And now that I’m fired, I’m caught between whether I still have to do it or not.

events.question: Oh, well, if it’s just for the project, then probably not. Is there another reason you would go?

events.text: Not to assume, I could be wrong, but from the hesitation, it sounds like there might be another reason?

You’re good, man. And you’re right.
I think it’s probably the right thing to do…Even if it doesn’t amount to anything.
[i]Hmm[/i], well, then you gotta go, right?
Yeah, I guess I do.

You got this.
Not that I know what “this” is, but you can do whatever you have to do!
Thanks, man, I appreciate it!
Yeahhh. I think so.
What is it? If you don’t mind me asking.

I think…I gotta do it for myself, you know?
Like I really want to help find a solution to the [b]Devil’s Lung[/b]. It’s no joke!
Sure.

Yeah, so I gotta just do it.
I think I’d regret it if I went to bed knowing that I could’ve helped more and chose not to.

That’s admirable.
I hope that you find whatever you’re looking for!
Thanks, man.
I should probably get going then, tell Rondeau and Tangeau that I said “bye!”
I will. See you around!
See you, man!
ORVEN!!!
I just wanted to say that if you need a job that’ll house you, we can do that for you at ABP!
Just let me know, and you’ve got a job with us.

!!!!!!
Are you serious??
Yeah! I know it won’t be like a permanent thing, but while you find your next job, we’d be happy to have you on the team!
Oh, okay! I got like zero options, so I’ll take you up on that offer!
I cannot tell you how much I appreciate this, Rondeau.
No worries, that’s what friends are for!
I owe you, man, I’ll see you soon!
See you, Orven!
Uncle Rondeau!
I want “Ups,” Uncle Rondeau!
Of course! What’s the magic password?
TONGO!
That’s right!!! Uncle [i]Tongo!
[i]WHEE!!!
Where’s Uncle Tangeau, Uncle Rondeau?

Oh, uh, he just left.
He didn’t know you guys were coming!
Oh, darn. I wanted to talk to him about this new piece I’ve learned.
[shake rate=20.0 level=5 connected=1][i]WHEE!!!
I’m sure he’ll love to hear about it next time!
Why don’t you introduce yourself to our friend here?

Hi there!
My name is Orven Zanry, what’s yours?
My name is Lunette and Matty is over there with Uncle Rondeau.
[i]WHEE!!!
It’s very nice to meet you, Miss Lunette!

He called you “Miss,” Lunette!
Are you a “Miss?”
[i]giggle
Very nice to meet you, Mr. Orven!

I’m Meldan, I’m their babysitter.
Nice to meet you, Orven!
Nice to meet you, Meldan!
Must be a rich family if they got you babysitting in that uniform.
The same rich family as yours!

!!!!!!
[color=#ffed29](His lapel!)

You work for the Avidines?
These are THE AVIDINE KIDS??
[i]Haha[/i], yup.
My Dad’s name is Ret Avidine. [i]Technically[/i], his real name is “Retter,” but no one calls him that.
Only Mom when she’s [i]really[/i] mad.
And Mom’s name is Flaire Avidine. She doesn’t have a nickname like I don’t have one!

Wow, that’s really cool!
What’s your favorite part about your mom and dad?

Uhh, for Dad, I like his big hugs.
When I’m scared, I can go to Dad’s room and he hugs me really tight until I don’t feel scared anymore! I just feel Dad’s hugs.

For mom? I like when she plays her flute with me.
I can play my piano when she plays her flute! And she always says she’s proud of me and that she loves me lots!
They sound like good parents.
The best in the whole world!
[i]Haha[/i], even when they tell you to go easy on Matty in games?

…...
It’s not my fault he’s not as good as me!
[i]Hahaha[/i]! It looks like you’re a little bit older than Matty.
I’m six years older than him!
Do you think that’s maybe why you’re so much better at these games?
But I’m better than Meldan at Runner, too!
[color=#ffed29](The card game?)

[color=#ffed29](Gramma wouldn’t let me play because she said it was a game for gambling.)
[color=#ffed29](But Herb taught me, and it’s fun with or without the betting.)

!!!!!!
Meldan, are you going easy on me??
I TOLD YOU NOT TO GO EASY ON ME!
what should I say??
don’t look at me, man!
i think she’s onto you, time to plead guilty.
okay, okay.
Lunette, I’m sorry, I was going easy on you.
Meldan!
But if I go a little easy on you, we can play for longer!

Oh… I do like playing Runner.
Don’t go easy! I’ll get better, and then we can play longer and you can play your best.
[i]Haha[/i], okay, Lunette, I’ll do my best.
Good!
Sounds like you’re not going to be the best Runner player in the house for long.
Yeah, I think we’re in the presence of the new champion!
i mean, just say she’s just that good!
okay, okay.
Lunette, you’re just good at Runner! I’m learning your ways.
[color=#ffed29](Did she buy it???)
Mom and Dad say that the only thing worse than a liar, is a bad liar.
I think you’re bad at lying, Meldan…
[i]Ack.
sorry, man! i can’t lie, either.
[shake rate=20.0 level=5 connected=1]LUNETTE!!! SAVE ME!!!

[i]AH!!![/i] Uncle Rondeau!!!
You’re holding Matty upside-down!

Is he?
Isn’t this his head?

[i]giggle
No, Uncle Rondeau!
That’s his butt!!!
Is it?
[color=#ffed29](He’s a natural with them.)
You got a great job, man.
Yeah, I’m very lucky. They’re really good kids.
How’s Mr. Avidine at the factory?
Oh, I mean, it was great. I really believed in it, and I learned a lot.
But, uh…I don’t work for him anymore.
Oh, no? What happened?
I got fired…
Oh jeez, I’m sorry. Mr. Avidine fired you?
Nah, the guy underneath him.
I was going to say, that didn’t sound like him.
I’m sorry about that, man, that stinks.
Thanks, man, appreciate it.
Are you okay?

Yeah…you know, I was going to do something I didn’t [i]super[/i] wanna do today for the sake of like [b]Remedium[/b] and stuff.
And now that I’m fired, I’m caught between whether I still have to do it or not.

events.question: Oh, well, if it’s just for the project, then probably not. Is there another reason you would go?

events.text: Not to assume, I could be wrong, but from the hesitation, it sounds like there might be another reason?

You’re good, man. And you’re right.
I think it’s probably the right thing to do…Even if it doesn’t amount to anything.
[i]Hmm[/i], well, then you gotta go, right?
Yeah, I guess I do.

You got this.
Not that I know what “this” is, but you can do whatever you have to do!
Thanks, man, I appreciate it!
Yeahhh. I think so.
What is it? If you don’t mind me asking.

I think…I gotta do it for myself, you know?
Like I really want to help find a solution to the [b]Devil’s Lung[/b]. It’s no joke!
Sure.

Yeah, so I gotta just do it.
I think I’d regret it if I went to bed knowing that I could’ve helped more and chose not to.

That’s admirable.
I hope that you find whatever you’re looking for!
Thanks, man.
I should probably get going then, tell Rondeau that I said “bye!”
I will. See you around!
See you, man!
ORVEN!!!
I just wanted to say that if you need a job that’ll house you, we can do that for you at ABP!
Just let me know, and you’ve got a job with us.

!!!!!!
Are you serious??
Yeah! I know it won’t be like a permanent thing, but while you find your next job, we’d be happy to have you on the team!
Oh, okay! I got like zero options, so I’ll take you up on that offer!
I cannot tell you how much I appreciate this, Rondeau.
No worries, that’s what friends are for!
I owe you, man, I’ll see you soon!
See you, Orven!
